message.content:
1.  ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE

   •  Block Count and Layers  
      -  The structure uses a total of 6 blocks.  
      -  Visually it can be thought of in three “layers”:  
         1) A flat green rectangular block at the bottom,  
         2) Three tall yellow pillars and one red cube in the middle,  
         3) A flat green rectangular block on top.  

   •  Spatial Arrangement  
      -  The bottom green block forms a horizontal base.  
      -  Three tall yellow rectangular blocks stand upright on this base: two at the “front” edges and one behind them, leaving an open center space.  
      -  A red cube sits on the bottom green block, centered between the three yellow pillars.  
      -  A second green rectangular block spans across the top of the three yellow pillars, serving as the top “cap.”  

2.  SELECTING THE REQUIRED BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY

   •  Required Shapes, Colors, and Orientations  
      1) Two green flat (horizontal) rectangular blocks for the top and bottom → dictionary block index 7 (used twice).  
      2) Three tall yellow rectangular pillars → dictionary block index 13 (used three times).  
      3) One red cube → dictionary block index 4.  

   •  Final List of Block Indices  
      [7, 13, 13, 13, 4, 7]  

   (Order here is not necessarily assembly order—just the set of blocks needed.)

3.  ASSEMBLY ORDER

   Below is one possible step‐by‐step sequence using the required blocks exactly in their dictionary orientations:

   {
     Step1: Move block with index 7   (place the bottom green rectangle)
     Step2: Move block with index 13  (place the first tall yellow pillar)
     Step3: Move block with index 13  (place the second tall yellow pillar)
     Step4: Move block with index 13  (place the third tall yellow pillar)
     Step5: Move block with index 4   (place the red cube in the center)
     Step6: Move block with index 7   (place the top green rectangle)
   }
